The [Justus Liebig University Gießen](https://www.uni-giessen.de/cms/welcome?set_language=en) has updated its APC expenditures. The latest contribution provides data for the 2016 and 2017 periods.

The [JLU University Library](https://www.uni-giessen.de/ub/en?set_language=en) is in charge of the [University's Open Access Publishing Fund](https://www.uni-giessen.de/ub/en/digitales-publizieren-en/openaccess-en/oafonds-en?set_language=en), which is supported by the DFG under its [Open-Access Publishing Programme](http://www.dfg.de/en/research_funding/programmes/infrastructure/lis/funding_opportunities/open_access/).

Contact person is [Florian Ruckelshausen](mailto:openaccess@bibsys.uni-giessen.de).

## Cost data

```{r, cache.lazy = TRUE}
#' Download APC spreadsheet from github which requires to Curl installed

download_apc <- function(path = NULL, dir = "tmp", file = "apc_de.csv"){
  if(is.null(path)) {
    path <- c("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenAPC/openapc-de/master/data/apc_de.csv")
    } 
  dir.create(dir) 
  download.file(url = path, destfile = paste(dir, file, sep = "/"), method = "curl")
  read.csv(paste(dir, file, sep = "/"), header = T,sep =",")
}

my.apc <- download_apc()
my.apc <- my.apc[my.apc$institution == "Giessen U",]
my.apc <- droplevels(my.apc)
my.apc_2016_17 <- download_apc(c("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenAPC/openapc-de/master/data/jlu_giessen/giessen_apc_2016_2017_enriched.csv"))
my.apc_2016_17 <- droplevels(my.apc_2016_17)
```

The new dataset covers publication fees for `r format(nrow(my.apc_2016_17), big.mark =",")` articles. Total expenditure amounts to `r sum(my.apc_2016_17$euro)`€ and the average fee is `r sum(my.apc_2016_17$euro)/nrow(my.apc_2016_17)`€.

The following table shows the payments the JLU library has made to publishers in 2016 and 2017.

```{r}
d_frame = data.frame(table(my.apc_2016_17$publisher,  dnn="Publisher"))                 
d_frame = d_frame[with(d_frame, order(-Freq, Publisher)), ]                                           
                                    
my.apc_2016_17$publisher <- factor(my.apc_2016_17$publisher, levels =  d_frame$Publisher)

df.summary <-cbind(tapply(my.apc_2016_17$euro, my.apc_2016_17$publisher, length),
             tapply(my.apc_2016_17$euro, my.apc_2016_17$publisher, sum),
             tapply(my.apc_2016_17$euro, my.apc_2016_17$publisher, mean))

colnames(df.summary) <- c("Articles", "Fees paid in EURO", "Mean Fee paid")

knitr::kable(as.data.frame(df.summary), digits = 2)
```

## Overview

With the recent contribution included, the overall APC data for the JLU now looks as follows:

### Fees paid per publisher (in EURO)

```{r tree_giessen_2017_06_13_full}
tt <- aggregate(my.apc$euro, by = list(my.apc$publisher), sum)
colnames(tt) <- c("Publisher", "Euro")
treemap::treemap(tt, index = c("Publisher"), vSize = "Euro", palette = "Paired")
```

###  Average costs per year (in EURO)

```{r box_giessen_2017_06_13_year_full, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE}
require(ggplot2)
q <- ggplot(my.apc, aes(factor(period), euro)) + geom_boxplot() + geom_point()
q <- q +  ylab("Fees paid (in EURO)") + theme(legend.position="top") + theme_bw(base_size = 18)
q + xlab("Funding period") + ylab("APC")
```

###  Average costs per publisher (in EURO)

```{r box_giessen_2017_06_13_publisher_full, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}
require(ggplot2)
d_frame = data.frame(table(my.apc$publisher,  dnn="Publisher"))                 
d_frame = d_frame[with(d_frame, order(-Freq, Publisher)), ]
publishers = as.character(d_frame$Publisher[d_frame$Freq > 2])
my.apc_reduced = my.apc[my.apc$publisher %in% publishers,]

  
q <- ggplot(my.apc_reduced, aes(publisher, euro)) + geom_boxplot() + geom_point()
q <- q +  ylab("Fees paid (in EURO)") + theme(legend.position="top") + theme_bw(base_size = 18) + coord_flip()
q + xlab("Publisher (> 2 articles)") + ylab("APC")
```
